Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: பொச்சாப்புக் கொல்லும் புகழை அறிவினை நிச்ச நிரப்புக்கொன் றாங்கு.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: Forgetfulness will destroy fame, even as constant poverty destroys knowledge.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A diptych. On the left, a grand, shining monument representing a person's Fame ('புகழ்') is being consumed and destroyed by a creeping, dark mist representing Forgetfulness ('பொச்சாப்பு').
Layered_Composition.Midground: On the right, for comparison, a brilliant, glowing brain representing Knowledge ('அறிவு') is being slowly extinguished and starved by the gaunt, skeletal hands of Perpetual Poverty ('நிச்ச நிரப்பு').
Layered_Composition.Background: Both scenes are set in a desolate, timeless void to emphasize the destructive principles at work.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: A parallel of destruction: Forgetfulness kills fame in the same way that persistent poverty kills knowledge.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The mist consuming the monument is a metaphor for forgetfulness destroying fame. The skeletal hands of poverty extinguishing the light of knowledge is the parallel destruction.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The left panel has the dark mist slowly snuffing out the golden light of the monument. The right panel has the skeletal hands casting a deep shadow that puts out the bright light of the brain.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A balanced, two-panel shot that makes the visual analogy clear and powerful.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, with high-quality mist and light effects.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Symbolic lighting that shows light being overcome by darkness in both scenarios.
